channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: The Big Story Podcast: Long-term repercussions of Ivan Lim candidacy withdrawal?
item.description:
June 30, 2020 6:30 AM

This is a special GE 2020 analysis episode of The Straits Times' video series The Big Story.

item.title: School students, staff who had contact with patient test negative
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

All 39 students and 11 staff of East Spring Secondary School who were in contact with a Covid-19 infected student have tested negative, Education Minister Ong Ye Kung said in a Facebook post yesterday.

item.title: Attractions shut, but staff still busy with upkeep
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

From maintaining flowering plants to caring for various wildlife to making sure that art pieces are kept at the right temperatures, attractions in Singapore have been keeping busy even though they have been closed for the last few months.

item.title: Back to school for all - and then hang out at the malls
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

It was back to the classroom full time for all students yesterday and many hit the malls and fast-food joints after the dismissal bell rang.

item.title: Four more dengue deaths as cases surge
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Four more people have died of dengue, bringing the total number of deaths this year from the viral infection to 16, as of June 23.

item.title: Three outlets, a worker fined for breaches since phase 2 reopening
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Since the start of Singapore's phase two reopening on June 19, three businesses and an individual have been fined following inspections of workplaces and malls here, Enterprise Singapore (ESG) said in a statement yesterday.

item.title: 4 weeks' jail for woman who bribed ICA officer
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

A woman was jailed for four weeks for bribing an Immigration and Checkpoints Authority (ICA) customer service officer with $1,500 to expedite her application for Singapore permanent resident (PR) status.

item.title: HSA flags two weight-loss products sold online
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Two products sold on e-commerce platforms as weight-loss supplements have been found to contain harmful substances.

item.title: 3,300 in shelters, children's homes and centres tested by tomorrow
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

About 3,300 staff, residents and clients of various homes, shelters and centres would have been tested for Covid-19 by tomorrow, Minister for Social and Family Development Desmond Lee announced yesterday.

item.title: Pofma correction directions issued to 2 Facebook pages
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

The Protection from Online Falsehoods and Manipulation Act (Pofma) Office yesterday issued a correction direction each to two Facebook pages for false statements about cross-border travel arrangements between Singapore and Malaysia.

item.title: 780 disadvantaged kids to get help to access $3,000 grant
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

When Ms Zamaira Bibi, 34, a divorcee with three daughters, heard about the Child Development Account (CDA) First Step grant, she thought her children were not eligible as she did not have a valid marriage certificate.

item.title: SAF has kept operational edge despite Covid-19: Ng Eng Hen
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) has maintained its operational edge despite the wide-ranging impact of the coronavirus pandemic, which halted exercises and delayed acquisitions, said Defence Minister Ng Eng Hen.

item.title: Tobacco product packaging to be standardised from July 1
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

All tobacco products sold in Singapore will be subject to standardised packaging from tomorrow.

item.title: SAF training safety has 'improved significantly'
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

There has been a significant improvement in training safety in the Singapore Armed Forces since the Inspector-General's Office (IGO) was set up last year, said Defence Minister Ng Eng Hen.

item.title: Coronavirus: Experts warn against letting guard down as community cases inch up
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore has seen an uptick in community cases 12 days into phase two of reopening the economy, which will be a concern if the trend continues, experts said.

item.title: Hong Kong court sets aside RWS bid to recover $1.6m from casino high roller
item.description:
June 30, 2020 5:00 AM

A Singapore casino's bid to recover a $1.64 million debt from a Macau-based high roller has suffered a setback after the Hong Kong High Court reversed an earlier decision to register a Singapore judgment against Mr Wong Fei Fu in the territory.
